title: Von Strasser 2013 Sori Bricco Vineyard Red (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Juicy, leathery and earthy on the palate, this is a densely extracted blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. It presents dry, lengthy tannins and a rusticity of dusty clove, finishing lean and restrained.

title: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Limited Release Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
description: Plum reigns supreme on the nose but there are also funky, earthy notes. The flavors are a lovely blend of red cherry, raspberry, rooibos tea, lavender and clove. This full-bodied wine has supple tannins and bright acidity, finishing long and dry.

title: SeaGlass 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Wet cement, cut grass and fresh oregano aromas show on the nose of this affordable white. Dried herb, hay and kaffir lime flavors come through on the palate, making it an excellent choice for weekday sipping.

title: La Calonica 2012 San Venerio Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: This opens with toast, ground pepper, grilled herb and sawdust aromas. The palate is firm with grippy tannins but expressive, evoking sour cherry, roasted coffee bean, oak and star anise.

title: Poggio alla Sala 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Subtle plum, blue flower and toast aromas come together in this red. The tightly wound, firmly tannic palate offers fleshy black cherry, star anise and clove flavors.

title: Poggio dell'Aquila 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This straightforward, robust red displays subtle black-skinned fruit, leather and forest floor aromas. The rounded, already approachable palate delivers red plum, baking spice and tobacco flavors held firm with tannins.

title: Quercia al Poggio 2012  Chianti Classico
description: This blend of 80% Sangiovese, 12% Ciliegiolo, 6% Canaiolo and 2% Colorino displays spice-laced blackberry and leather aromas. On the palate, firm, grainy tannins frame mature plum, espresso, tobacco and clove flavors. Drink through 2019.

title: Piaggia 2014 Il Sasso  (Carmignano)
description: Made of 70% Sangiovese, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot, this opens with black currant, leather and underbrush aromas. Black cherry, clove and white pepper flavors come forward on the palate, with a polished edge to the tannins. Enjoy through 2018.

title: Pietro Beconcini 2015 Antiche Vie  (Chianti)
description: This blend of 70% Sangiovese with Canaiolo, Colorino, Ciliegiolo and Malvasia shows fruity berry and violet aromas. On the palate, juicy black plum fruit is laced with baking spice and structured by smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Tringali Casanuova 2014 Casa al Piano  (Bolgheri)
description: This red combines Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon to create black currant and Mediterranean herb aromas. The easygoing, approachable palate shows black cherry and dark spice flavors, framed by polished tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2013 Old Vine Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: Matured in used French barriques, this nevertheless shows touches of toast and cedar alongside tart, fruit notes of cranberry and raspberry. It's full bodied and richly tannic, with crisp acids that accentuate the tannins on the finish. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2011 Redi Briareo Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this offers black tea and mature plum aromas, while the palate evokes dried cherry, clove and star anise flavors. Firm, close-grained tannins generate an austere finish. Give it another few years to soften, then enjoy.

title: Château Mauvesin Barton 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: This is the first vintage under the Barton (of Léoville-Barton) family ownership. It is a structured wine with some dense tannins and acidity. The fruit is behind the tannins and will probably leave a firm wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Pomeys 2014  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: This is a smooth wine full of black fruits and with a backdrop of fine tannins. It has a rich juicy character from the black plum and berry fruits along with bright acidity. The wine, a blend of 55% Merlot and 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Tour Seran 2014  Médoc
description: Jean Guyon owns a group of estates in the northern Médoc village of Bégadan. This wine (blended by a former “best sommelier in the world”) has a high proportion of Merlot. That produces a wine that is smooth and likely to develop easily and quickly. With its touch of tannin, it is balanced and fruity. Drink from 2019.

title: Colombaio 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This has black plum, mocha and underbrush aromas, while blackberry jam, prune and licorice flavors mark the dense, mature palate. Assertive tannins provide support. Drink 2018–2023.

title: Crimson Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This easy-to-love wine from the Michael Mondavi family has an obvious but attractive oaky character, from the abundant cedar and cinnamon aromas to the spicy nutmeg and cardamom flavors that bolster its red cherry fruit and medium body.

title: Château Bel-Air Ouÿ 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This wine is spicy, with attractive fruitiness, a strong line of acidity and ample tannins. The wine is perfumed, with a generous aftertaste.

title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: In the south of the Médoc and away from the Gironde estuary, this vineyard has produced a wine that is half Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot. That blend gives the wine its structure as well as the juicy black-currant acidity. The wood aging has filled the wine out to give a bottle with good aging potential. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Castera 2014  Médoc
description: Both the tannins and the wood aging flavors are strongly evident in this wine at this stage. But with the intense black-currant fruit and the acidity, it is going to be a ripe while also structured wine. The estate dates to the 14th century. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Doyac 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Because it is planted in clay and limestone soil, this wine is inevitably dominated by Merlot. The wood-aging flavor shows strongly with spice and toast while the fruit is just beginning to hint at a black-currant future. It is rich and full, needing time. Drink from 2022.

title: Château La Serre 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: Ripe berry fruits give this wine its richness. There is a strong acidity as well that cuts through the wine leaving a stalky tight young fruitiness. Let the wine soften and drink from 2020.

title: Bodegas Yuste NV Aurora Amontillado Sherry (Jerez)
description: Initially, this is sharp up the nostrils, and after that it's obtuse and somewhat wayward. Briny salty nutty flavors lead the charge, but beyond that it's hard to find anything elevated or specific in this amontillado that finishes with controlled bitterness.

title: Boxwood 2014 Trellis Red (Middleburg)
description: Fresh and bright, the nose of this wine is filled with bramble fruit, lavender and violet candy. The palate is racy, with red cherry, pomegranate, lavender and violet. Smooth tannins lead to a silky finish.

title: Brigadoon 2014 Lylee Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The first release annually from the estate vineyard, this is a solid effort, seemingly infused with scents and flavors of pine needle, pine tar, earth and bark. The fruit is in the background, and leans toward cranberry and brambly blackberry.

title: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Wild blackberry fruit and savory, dried-leaf highlights take hold here. The tannins are drying, tea-like, and there's a pleasant, earthy note carrying into the finish. The wine is 60% estate fruits, and spent nine months in 30% new French oak.

title: Caiarossa 2011 Oro di Caiarossa Petit Manseng (Toscana)
description: Made entirely from late harvested Petit Manseng, this sweet, round dessert wine opens with ripe apricot and baked pear aromas. The straightforward palate delivers lemon honey, mature melon and vanilla flavors. Enjoy it soon.

title: Carabella 2014 Dijon 76 Estate Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Bright gold, with hints of caramel and butter in the nose, this offers fully ripe apple flesh and skin, in a sharp tightly strung frame. A brief decanting or aeration would be helpful.

title: Carabella 2014 Plowbuster Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: The Plowbuster blends in Southern Oregon Pinot with the Willamette Valley fruit—a winning combo in many value-priced offerings. There's ample acidity and drying tannins, in a gulpable wine that is zippy with fresh raspberry and cherry-fruit flavors.

title: Castellani 2012  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with delicate black-skinned fruit and cooking spice aromas. Smooth tannins frame the prune, clove and cinnamon flavors on the palate. Enjoy through 2018.
